title: Bridging the innovation gap through converting R&D results into commercial success in a more effective and efficient way
abstract: High regional expenditure on R&D does not necessarily lead to innovation and increased regional competitiveness if the regional economy is hampered by insufficient exploitation of its own R&D results and from a lack of access to public R&D results. Increasing SMEs’ competitiveness is at the core of the InnoBridge project by improving the Innovation Bridge and related policy instruments for SMEs: “Bridging the innovation gap through converting R&D results into commercial success in a more effective and efficient way”. This enables SMEs to better realise their innovation potential and to act as a catalyst for creating more high qualified jobs and regional growth. The partnership consists of 9 partners from 8 regions in 8 countries spread over Europe with a balance of advanced and less advanced regions. Project phase 1 (3 years) is dedicated to an intensive interregional exchange and learning process on the Innovation Bridge with involvement of regional stakeholders (Peer Reviews, Study Visits, Capacity Building Workshops, Staff Exchanges). This approach facilitates the development of Action Plans, which are implemented in phase 2 (2 years). Strong involvement of the responsible authorities for the 8 addressed policy instruments – as direct partner or as stakeholder group member – ensures the durability of the implemented improvements and the long-term impact on SMEs’ innovativeness in the partner regions. All instruments are part of RIS3, 7 instruments are dealing with Structural Funds. An estimated total amount of 30.4 M EUR, influenced through InnoBridge implementation demonstrates the strong leverage effect for regional and European policies as added value. The InnoBridge Concept Paper with InnoBridge methodology, Good Practice knowledge pool and lessons learnt, summarises the exchange and learning process and is disseminated EU wide. The project is supported by intensive communication activities like website, newsletters, social media and 2 conferences.

motivations: High regional expenditure on R&D does not necessarily translate to innovation and increased regional competitiveness due to insufficient exploitation of R&D results.
SMEs face challenges in realizing their innovation potential and accessing public R&D results, hindering regional growth and job creation.
objectives: Improve the Innovation Bridge and related policy instruments for SMEs to enhance their competitiveness and innovation potential.
Enable SMEs to better convert R&D results into commercial success through more effective and efficient means.
Foster regional growth and job creation by supporting SMEs as catalysts for innovation.
methods: Facilitate interregional exchange and learning processes among partners through peer reviews, study visits, capacity-building workshops, and staff exchanges.
Develop and implement Action Plans to improve policy instruments and support SME innovation.
Ensure strong involvement of responsible authorities and stakeholders to guarantee the durability of implemented improvements.
results: Enhance SMEs' innovativeness and competitiveness in partner regions.
Improve the effectiveness and efficiency of converting R&D results into commercial success.
Contribute to regional growth and job creation through increased innovation and competitiveness.
llama_json.research_subject: Bridging the innovation gap by improving the conversion of R&D results into commercial success for SMEs

motivations: High regional expenditure on R&D does not necessarily lead to innovation and increased regional competitiveness due to insufficient exploitation of R&D results and lack of access to public R&D results.
There is a need to improve the Innovation Bridge and related policy instruments for SMEs to increase their competitiveness.
objectives: Bridge the innovation gap by converting R&D results into commercial success in a more effective and efficient way.
Enable SMEs to better realize their innovation potential and act as a catalyst for creating more high qualified jobs and regional growth.
Develop Action Plans through an intensive interregional exchange and learning process on the Innovation Bridge.
methods: Implement an intensive interregional exchange and learning process involving regional stakeholders through Peer Reviews, Study Visits, Capacity Building Workshops, and Staff Exchanges.
Develop and implement Action Plans in two project phases.
Ensure the durability of the implemented improvements and the long-term impact on SMEs’ innovativeness through strong involvement of the responsible authorities.
results: Increased competitiveness of SMEs through better realization of their innovation potential.
Creation of more high qualified jobs and regional growth.
Long-term impact on SMEs’ innovativeness in the partner regions.
openai_json.research_subject: Bridging the innovation gap through effective conversion of R&D results into commercial success

motivations: High regional R&D expenditure often fails to translate into innovation and increased competitiveness due to insufficient exploitation of research results.
SMEs lack adequate access to public R&D results and face barriers in converting research outcomes into commercial success.
objectives: Improve the Innovation Bridge and related policy instruments to enhance SMEs' ability to convert R&D results into commercial success.
Increase SMEs' competitiveness and innovation potential to catalyze job creation and regional growth.
Facilitate interregional exchange and learning to develop and implement improved innovation support mechanisms.
methods: Conduct intensive interregional exchange and learning activities including Peer Reviews, Study Visits, Capacity Building Workshops, and Staff Exchanges.
Develop Action Plans through stakeholder involvement and implement them across partner regions.
Create and disseminate an InnoBridge Concept Paper documenting methodology, good practices, and lessons learned.
results: Enhanced innovation capacity of SMEs leading to increased competitiveness and creation of high-qualified jobs.
Improved policy instruments with an estimated influence on 30.4 M EUR demonstrating strong leverage effect for regional and European policies.
Sustainable improvements in innovation support systems through strong involvement of responsible authorities and stakeholder groups.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Innovation bridge mechanisms for converting R&D results into commercial success for SMEs
